Subject: [cantera]Building Matlab toolbox under linux
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=241219045; y=XCIdWllS2Gv6ll4uiuWUV_0P2BVSQFy8BzfTA0Ut9wZIIz_L

Dear Cantera Users,

There were a few post asking how to build the Cantera toolbox for 
Matlab under linux but
I didn't see any post describing how so I decide to post my experience here.

Since the GCC version and Glibc version came with Matlab are different 
from the one with
which we build cantera, You would probably see a message like this when 
you use the
toolbox:

/usr/local/matlab/bin/glnx86/../../sys/os/glnx86/libgcc_s.so.1:
version `GCC_3.3' not found (required by /usr/lib/libstdc++.so.6).

I am not sure about OS X but the linux workaround is to let Matlab use 
the library on
your system instead of the one came with Matlab. Try this:

cd $MATLAB
cd sys/os/glnx86
mkdir old
mv libstdc++.* libg2c.* libgcc_s* old

Then recompile your Cantera and install the new toolbox. This should 
work for both linux
and OS X. I made it work with SuSe 10 using gcc 4.0.2.

Best Regards,

Ricky
